text: Kanwaka is an unincorporated community in Douglas County, Kansas. It is 4 miles west of Lawrence. The name is a portmanteau of the Kansas and Wakarusa Rivers. Kanwaka is at the intersection of U.S. Highway 40 and Stull Road. The name Kanwaka actually refers to an area, not a town.Soil of Our Souls by Martha Parker & Betty Laird. Parker-Laird Enterprises, 1976 ==History== Kanwaka was first settled in 1854. Kanwaka had a post office from 1857 to 1870 and again from 1898 until 1900. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Douglas County, Kansas Category:1854 establishments in Kansas Territory
title: Kanwaka, Kansas
